heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

storm.status: The last storm was on 04 September 2025 which lasted for 1 days.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (181°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 53.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph was the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1754 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 6.0°C) and outside temperature (down 4.5°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 12%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 1048 m) and light levels (up 7469 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 9692 lux) and cloud levels (up 1390 m) when compared to today.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 835m and a peak of 3910m, averaging 1137.5m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; you can expect comfortable, mild temperatures. Also, air moisture should feel ok and very little to no wind will be present. A few light raindrops may fall, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. Similar weather conditions should remain.
